text:
Ro: Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another
Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: Today, ah! I have a very special guest,
it’s Dawin!

Dawin: What’s up guys! Thank you guys so much
for having me!

Ro: I’m so excited to have him, I’m gonna
put all his links down below,
Ro: So you should go check him out, say hi!

Ro: He’s a very talented music artist and
I love his song Dessert!

Dawin: Oooh, I’m very happy to hear that,
I’m flattered. Ro: I love it!

Dawin: Today we’re gonna be baking some
Harry Potter Desserts.

Ro: Yep! We got so many requests from you
guys to make Pumpkin Pasties. Dawin: Oooh!

Ro: Are you ready? Dawin: I’m ready! Ro:
OK, 1, 2, 3…
Both: Let’s get started!

Ro: The things you will need will be: 1 can
of pumpkin, 1 can of evaporated milk,

Ro: 1 cup of sugar, 2 tablespoons of unsalted
butter, 2 eggs, 1/2 a teaspoon

Ro: of cardamom, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1/2 a
teaspoon of allspice,

Ro: 1 teaspoon of cinnamon, 1/2 a teaspoon
of cloves and 1 teaspoon of ginger!

Ro: And you’re also gonna need 2 boxes of
pre-made pie crust, you can use a

Ro: made from scratch recipe, I can put a link
down below if you'd like to make your

Ro: pie recipe from scratch, but I’m just
using these to make it a little bit easier!

Ro: You will also need… Dawin: So, you’re
gonna need a hand mixer, a mixing bowl,

Dawin: cooking spray, round cookie cutter,
a glass baking pan, a baking sheet

Dawin: lined with parchment paper, a knife,
fork, small ice cream scoop
Dawin: and lastly, a can opener.
Ro: Now let’s put it all together!

Ro: But before we get started, we gotta protect
your outfit! Dawin: Hmmm.

Ro: Because this is pretty cute, hold on let
me get you something.
Ro: It’s a Hogwarts Original!

Ro: Oh my gosh, yes, yes, yes! Dawin: Why
thank you so much!

Ro: This is probably what they wear in spell
class, because when they’re making

Ro: all those potions they don’t want to
mess up their little outfits.

Ro: Oh yeah, you’re ready for Hogwarts,
look at you! Dawin: Thank you so much!
Ro: Adorable! Dawin: Hey guys, how do I look?
Ro: Watch out Professor Snape! Dawin’s here!

Ro: The first thing that we’re gonna do
is beat together our eggs, Dawin I’m gonna

Ro: have you, mixer. Dawin: Awesome. Ro: You’re
gonna work the mixer.

Ro: And I’m gonna crack the eggs, this is
the messy part. Dawin: Ooooh.
Ro: Ah, oop! OK…

Dawin: Let’s mix! Ro: Go for it, go for
it! Ro: I’ll hold the bowl.

Dawin: Oooooh! Ro: Nice job! Keep going, keep
going!

Dawin: I’m proud of myself! Ro: He’s doing
good!
Ro: Now we are gonna add our sugar, doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!

Ro: We’re gonna mix it one more time until
it’s evenly combined and
Ro: We’re gonna make it light and fluffy.
Dawin: So, now that we’ve mixed this, what's next?

Ro: We are gonna be adding our spices, so Dawin,
you just add all those spices in.

Ro: And then over here, I’m gonna open this
can add all of our pumpkin ingredient,
Ro: and, add our melted butter.
Dawin: Ba-ba-ba-bam! Ro: Teamwork!

Ro: Now all your friends are gonna be jealous
because you're gonna know how to make a

Ro: pumpkin pie. Dawin: They’re gonna have
to watch the video!
Ro: Yep! Dawin: And figure it out for themselves!

Ro: Did I ever tell you that I’m a professional
baker?

Dawin: I’m a professional mixer… If that
helps?
Ro: Alright, here goes the pumpkin… Uh-oh.

Ro: Uh-oh, uh-oh! Dawin: Here we go! It’s
not coming out? Ro: Yeah…

Ro: Accio Fork! Dawin: Whoa, where did that
come from?
Ro: Oh, I’m magic! Dawin: Magic!
Ro: Oh! And it came out anyways!

Ro: I feel like we’re in potions class,
like, we just added everything into

Ro: our mixing bowl and now we’re gonna mix
it together. You guys are gonna want to

Ro: mix it together until everything is evenly
combined.

Ro: Do you have a favorite type of pie? I
like Apple. Dawin: I love apple, oh!

Dawin: Right here! Ro: What!?!? Dawin: Apple
Pie!
Dawin: Whoa this feels like a workout.

Ro: Yeah, how do you guys think I stay in
shape?

Ro: I have a microwave dance. Dawin: Really?
Can I see it? Ro: Yeah.

Ro: OK, so I started the Nerdy Nummies dance
like this.

Ro: But sometimes I just do this. Dawin:
Wiggle. Ro: Yeah, pretty much.

Ro: We’re almost done, we have one last
thing to add, it’s a can of evaporated milk.

Ro: And then we’re gonna mix it one more
time!

Dawin: One more time! Ro: Da-na-na-na-na-na-na!
Na-na-na-na-na-na!
Both: Da-na-na-na-na-na-na-na! Na-na-na-na-na-na-na-na!

Ro: We are gonna be greasing our pan. It’s
just like hairspray, so you’re just

Ro: gonna spray the whole pan, so that the
mixture doesn’t stick.
Dawin: Yeah! Ro: There you go!

Ro: Now we’re gonna pour our pumpkin filling
mixture, so you just

Ro: pour it into the greased pan. Dawin: Yeah!
Ro: Oooooop! Dawin: Smooth!

Ro: And now we’re gonna take it over to
the oven.

Ro: We’re gonna put our pumpkin filling
mixture in the oven and bake at
Ro: 425 Degrees for 15 minutes.

Dawin: I’m taking a break now, Rosanna’s
finally taking over!
Ro: Yeah. Dawin: Exhausting!

Ro: He’s been mixing all day! Dawin: Oh
my goodness!

Ro: While our pumpkin filling is baking in
the oven we are gonna roll out our
Ro: pie crusts and cut some circles.

Ro: So, you’re just gonna open your pie
crusts. And again, we are using

Ro: the pre-made kind, but you can make from
scratch, that’s fine too.

Ro: Take a little end, and you’re gonna
gently peel it open.

Ro: Now you’re gonna take your circle cookie
cutter and just cut out a bunch

Ro: of circles. Once you’ve got them cut
out you’re gonna remove your excess pie crust.

Ro: Took our pumpkin Pie filling out of the
oven and it’s had plenty of time

Ro: to cool. Dawin: This actually smells very
good!
Ro: Mmmm, it smells like pumpkin pie.

Ro: These are super easy to assemble, let
me show you how to do one..

Ro: So you take a little scoop with your ice
cream scoop, and you're gonna place it

Ro: on one of the ends of your pie dough.
And then you fold it in half over your

Ro: scoop. And then you pick it up and pinch
the sides. It’s OK if a little

Ro: bit of the filling comes out, that’s
OK. Sometimes that happens.
Dawin: Keep these here. Ro: Now you're gonna take your fork, and this is just for pretty design.

Ro: Press down with the fork, all the way
around, making little lines.

Ro: And now, for the final design you’re
gonna take your sharp knife and we’re just gonna

Ro: cut three lines. I think it looks really cute
like that. And these lines also help the pastry

Ro: vent while it’s baking, so it’s double
purpose.

Ro: Then you’re just gonna place it over
here on the baking sheet lined with

Ro: parchment paper, boom! And we’re gonna
assemble a bunch more yummy treats!

Dawin: Yum, yum, yum! I learned something
new today.

Ro: Do you have a favorite candy? Dawin: Um,
right now, what’s it, yeah!

Dawin: I like Reese’s. Do you like peanut
butter? What’s your favorite candy?

Ro: Red Vines. Dawin: Red Vines? Ro: Yeah,
but you’re east coast.

Ro: All our friends on the east coast like
Twizzlers more.

Dawin: Oh, I see. Ro: And all our friends
on the west coast like Red Vines more.

Ro: So being from the east coast… Dawin:
I don’t even think I’ve had a Red Vine before.

Ro: You’ve never had a Red Vine? Dawin:
Haven’t had a Red Vine. I’ve had Twizzlers.

Ro: And you’re from the east coast. Dawin:
And I’m from the east coast.
Ro: This adds up!

Dawin: But I guess I’m in the right place,
maybe I can have one! Ro: Yeah!
Ro: I might have got one lying around.

Dawin: So we got all these done, now we’re
gonna bake them at 350 degrees

Dawin: for 12 minutes. Ro: Mmmhmmm. Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum!
Dawin: Yum-yum-yum!
Both: Ta-da!

Ro: Here are our Harry Potter Pumpkin Pasties
that we made today!

Ro: Thank you guys for suggesting them and,
a big thank you to Dawin for

Ro: helping me in the kitchen today! Dawin:
Thanks again for having me!

Dawin: I’m happy to be here and I can’t
wait to taste these!

Ro: Ah, wait wait! What about, wait! Gotta
share the dessert! Dawin: You right.

Ro: Also, I’ll be putting all of his links
down below, so again, go check him out

Ro: go say hi, and check out his song Dessert!
Dawin: Whatcha gon’ do!?!

Ro: Because it’s my favorite! Whatcha gon’
do with that dessert!?

Ro: And if you have any other ideas for any
other Nerdy Nummies,

Ro: let me know, leave me a comment down below
and I will do my best to make

Ro: it happen! I’ll be posting lots of pictures
of these treats on all my social

Ro: medias, Instagram, Facebook, Tumblr, and
Twitter!

Ro: And if you guys make them, please take
a picture and send it to me.

Ro: I love seeing your baking creations! And,
you can tweet ‘em to Daiwin too!

Ro: Would you like to see their treats if
they make some?

Dawin: I would love to see some of your treats!
Send them over.

Ro: Cool! Alright, thanks again you guys!
Bye-bye! Dawin: Bye-bye guys!

Ro: I gotta ask you something. Dawin: What’s
up?
Ro: I found Red Vines. Dawin: Ooooh!

Ro: You want to do a taste test to see if
this is a real east coast-west coast thing?

Dawin: I’m up for a challenge. Ro: OK, let’s
do this.

Dawin: This is my first Red Vine guys, first
ever.

Ro: OK, so let’s taste test the Red Vine
first. Are you ready? Dawin: I’m ready.
Dawin: Mmmm!

Dawin: It’s good. Ro: Mmhmm! Dawin: It’s
really good.
Ro: Now, the east coast Twizzler.
Dawin: Rich in flavor. Ro: Still good.

Ro: If you had to pick between the two…
This is science.
Dawin: Red Vine.
Ro: Wooooooowwww!
Ro: Whoooaaaaaa!
Dawin: It feels so good!
Ro: Mm-mm-mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm-mmm! Dawin: Aye!
Dawin: Whatcha gon’ do with that dessert?
Ro: I’m gonna probably eat it!
